q_option: Transfer of atoms from one body to the other body.
Transfer of electricity from one body to the other body.
Transfer of electrons from one body to the other body.
Transfer of heat from one body to the other body.
1.q_string: Which of the following is a cause of electrification of two bodies when they are rubbed together?
If an electron is placed in an electric field of intensity of \(10^4\) Newton per Coulomb. The electric force working on the electron is:
If two nuclei have mass numbers in the ratio of \(27:125\), then what will be the ratio of their nuclear radii?
If \(\frac{1}{16}\) of the initial amount of a certain radioactive isotope remains undecayed after two hours, then what will be the half-life of the isotope?

What will be the voltage (in \(V\)) of a battery connected to a parallel plate capacitor (filled with air) when the area of the plate is \(10\) square centimeters, the separation between the plates is \(5\) mm and the charge stored on the plates is \(2 {nC}\)?
If the area of the parallel plate capacitor, as well as the distance between them, is halved, then what will happen to the capacitance of parallel plate capacitor?
For the applicability of Ohm's law, the temperature of conductor should be:

The potential gradient is used to measure the potential difference across a resistance of \(20 \Omega\). If the potential gradient of a potentiometer is \(3 \mathrm{mV} / \mathrm{cm}\) and a length of \(60 \mathrm{~cm}\) of the potentiometer wire is required to get the null point, then the current passing through the \(20 \Omega\) resistor is:
If a current carrying loop placed in magnetic field, then the torque acting on loop will not depend upon:

The length of a solenoid is \(50 \mathrm{~cm}\) and it has \(100\) turns, which carries a current of \(2.5 \mathrm{~A}\). What will be the magnetic field at the centre of the solenoid? \(\left(\mu_0=4 \pi \times 10^{-7} \mathrm{~T} \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~A}{ }^{-1}\right)\)
_______________  have higher retentivity of magnetism.

If a proton enters in a magnetic field of \(2500\) \(\mathrm{N} / \mathrm{Amp}-m\) intensity with velocity \(4 \times 10^5 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{sec}\) in parallel of field. The force exerted on proton will be:

q_option: The polarity of an electromagnet cannot be changed.
An electromagnet produces a comparatively weak force of attraction.
The strength of an electromagnet can be changed by changing the number of turns in its coil.
1.q_string: The statement that is true about an electromagnet is:

If a coil, which have inductive reactance \(31 \Omega\) has a resistance of \(8 \Omega\), is placed in series with a condenser of capacitance reactance \(25 \Omega\), then the combination is connected to an AC source of \(110 \mathrm{~V}\). The power factor of the circuit is:
In an AC circuit, the active power and apparent power are respectively measured in _______ respectively.
AC supply of \(220 \mathrm{~V}\) source is applied across a pure inductor of \(35 \mathrm{mH}\). If the frequency of the source is \(50 \mathrm{~Hz}\), then find the rms current in the circuit.

q_option: These waves do not require any material medium for propagation
Both electric and magnetic field vectors attains the maxima and minima at the same place and same time
Both electric and magnetic field vectors are parallel to each other and perpendicular to the direction of propagation of wave
The energy in electromagnetic wave is divided equally between electric and magnetic vectors
1.q_string: The incorrect statement regarding the properties of electromagnetic waves is:

q_option: The frequency of the microwaves must match the resonant frequency of the water molecules.
The frequency of the microwaves has no relation with natural frequency of water molecules.
Microwaves are heat waves, so always produce heating.
Infrared waves produce heating in a microwave oven.
1.q_string: The condition under which a microwave oven heats up a food item containing water molecules most efficiently is:

If a metal is irradiated by light \(\left( u_1=3.2 imes 10^{16} \mathrm{~Hz} ight)\) emits photo electrons with twice kinetic energy as did photo electrons when the same metal is irradiated by light \(\left( u_2=2.0 imes 10^{16} \mathrm{~Hz} ight)\). The \( u_0\) of metal is:
The kinetic energy of the particle is increased to \(16\) times its previous value, the percentage change in the de-Broglie wavelength of the particle is ____________.

If \(8100\) scintillations per minute are observed at an angle of \(60^{\circ}\) from the experiment of Rutherford's \(\alpha\)-scattering experiment with thin gold foil, then what will be the number of scintillations per minute at an angle of \(120^{\circ}\)?

q_option: Potential energy increases and Kinetic energy decreases
Potential energy increases and Kinetic energy decreases
Both Potential energy and Kinetic energy increases
Both Potential energy and Kinetic energy decreases
1.q_string: If a hydrogen atom is raised from the ground state to an excited stat, then:
Calculate the power gain of DC circuit if collector current is \(120 \mathrm{~mA}\) and base current is \(2 \mathrm{~mA}\) and resistance gain is \(3\).

If the base current in a transistor circuit changes from \(45 \mu \mathrm{A}\) to \(140 \mu \mathrm{A}\) and accordingly, the collector current changes from \(0.2 \mathrm{~mA}\) to \(4.00 \mathrm{~mA}\), then the gain in current is:
The phenomena of light which results in a mirage is ____________.
What will be the focal length of the convex lens which is dipped in a liquid whose refractive index is equal to the refractive index of the lens?
If a light ray is passed through a thin prism of prism angle \(8^{\circ}\), then find the refractive index of the prism if the angle of deviation is \(2^{\circ}\).

The source emitting wavelengths \(480 \mathrm{~nm}\) and \(600 \mathrm{~nm}\) are used in Young's Double Slit Experiment and the separation between the slits is \(0.25 \mathrm{~mm}\). The interference is observed \(1.5 \mathrm{~m}\) away from the slits. The linear separation between first maxima of the two wavelengths is:
When a plane wave passes through a convex lens, then the geometric shape of the wavefront will be:

The angular width of a fringe is found to be \(0.2^{\circ}\) on a screen placed \(1 \mathrm{~m}\) away in a double-slit experiment. The wavelength of light used is \(600 \mathrm{~nm}\). What will be the angular width of the fringe if the entire experiment apparatus is immersed in water? (Take refractive index of water to be \(\frac{4}{3}\))
